The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* #17428 (p2p: Try to preserve outbound block-relay-only connections during restart by hebasto)

If you consider this pull

Updated 00a3b45696fea7ad3a6c00b769ec6c2fc53c1b5c -> 756c9dcfa9e9b609ad7dd07c1e802c9f0a65c743 ([pr20076.01](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr20076.01) -> [pr20076.02](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr20076.02), [diff](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/compare/pr20076.01..pr20076.02)):\n\n- addressed @jonatack's comments, dropped unneeded grammar changes
@naumenkogs Mind looking into this doc update as it is about `ip_asn.map` file?

Everything looks good.\n\nW.r.t asmap, maybe instead of (or in addition to) linking a wikipedia article we should link some asmap-related info? I couldn't find a good webpage to link, so maybe just add "Experimental feature: see [asmap-CLI](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/42065518d937e036cce6b0ad21890f8fc2c50cfc/doc/release-notes/release-notes-0.20.0.md#new-settings) and [asmap-utility](
generally, the chain order in the codebase is main/test/signet/regtest
s/. Path/; path/ (to avoid full sentence structure and need for EOL full stop)\n\ns/with/by/ or /with/with the/

Since this is a full sentence, I guess it should have s/by/by the/.

Maybe

"A custom data directory path can be specified by the `-datadir` option."

or

"A non-default data directory path can be specified by the `-datadir` option."
